title: LR circuit - potential difference change with time

content.question: Voltmeters are used to measure the potential differences <math alttext="delta V sub R" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mi>V</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">R</mi></msub></math> across the resistor and <math alttext="delta V sub L" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mi>V</mi><mtext>L</mtext></msub></mstyle></math> across the inductor in the circuit shown. At time <math alttext="t sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>t</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math>, which occurs after the switch is closed, the voltmeters indicate <math alttext="delta V sub R equals delta V sub L, which equals 6 volts" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mi>V</mi><mtext>R</mtext></msub><mo>=</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mi>V</mi><mtext>L</mtext></msub><mo>=</mo><mn>6</mn><mtext>​​ V</mtext></mstyle></math>. The switch remains closed, and the potential differences indicated by the two meters are read again at time <math alttext="t sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>t</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math>, where <math alttext="t sub 2 is greater than t sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>t</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>t</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math>. Which of the following is a true statement about the voltmeter readings at time <math alttext="t sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>t</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math>?

choices.label: <math alttext="delta V sub R is greater than 6 volts" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mi>V</mi><mtext>R</mtext></msub><mo>></mo><mn>6</mn><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>V</mtext></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="delta V sub L is less than 6 volts" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mi>V</mi><mtext>L</mtext></msub><mo><</mo><mn>6</mn><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>V</mtext></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="delta V sub R is less than 6 volts" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mi>V</mi><mtext>R</mtext></msub><mo><</mo><mn>6</mn><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>V</mtext></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="delta V sub L is greater than 6 volts" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mi>V</mi><mtext>L</mtext></msub><mo>></mo><mn>6</mn><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>V</mtext></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="delta V sub R is greater than 6 volts" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mi>V</mi><mtext>R</mtext></msub><mo>></mo><mn>6</mn><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>V</mtext></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="delta V sub L is greater than 6 volts" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mi>V</mi><mtext>L</mtext></msub><mo>></mo><mn>6</mn><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>V</mtext></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="delta V sub R is less than 6 volts" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mi>V</mi><mtext>R</mtext></msub><mo><</mo><mn>6</mn><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>V</mtext></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="delta V sub L is less than 6 volts" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mi>V</mi><mtext>L</mtext></msub><mo><</mo><mn>6</mn><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>V</mtext></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="delta V sub R is greater than 6 volts" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mi>V</mi><mtext>R</mtext></msub><mo>></mo><mn>6</mn><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>V</mtext></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="delta V sub L is less than 6 volts" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mi>V</mi><mtext>L</mtext></msub><mo><</mo><mn>6</mn><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>V</mtext></mstyle></math>

topic.text: 13.5: Circuits with Resistors and Inductors (LR Circuits)

skill.text: 2.C: Compare physical quantities between two or more scenarios or at different times and locations in a single scenario.
